jparsec.astronomy

Class Difraction

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.astronomy.Difraction

  • public class Difraction
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements difraction correction to sky images, in order to make them look as through a telescope.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Method Detail

      • pattern

        public static double[][] pattern(double diam_obj,
                 double lambda,
                 int field,
                 double obstruc,
                 double spider)
        Obtain the difraction pattern of a point star supposing a perfect aligned telescope and lenses.
        Parameters:
        diam_obj - Diameter of the objective (supposed circular) in cm.
        lambda - Wave length in cm. Use 0.000056 (5600 angstrom) for visible light.
        field - Field of view of the pattern in arcseconds. In case is <1 it will be set to 1.
        obstruc - Diameter of the central obstruction of the telescope in cm. For Schmidth-Cassegrain or Newton instruments, otherwise set to 0.0.
        spider - Width of the spiders in cm, for Newton telescopes. Otherwise 0.0.
        Returns:
        An array with size (10*field)+1, (10*field)+1, representing the difraction pattern.

      • pattern

        public static double[][] pattern(TelescopeElement telescope,
                 int field)
        Obtain the difraction pattern in the visible of a point star supposing a perfect aligned telescope and lenses.
        Parameters:
        telescope - Telescope object.
        field - Field of view in arcseconds.
        Returns:
        An array with size (10*field)+1, (10*field+1), representing the difraction pattern over the given field.

      • resample

        public static double[][] resample(double[][] pattern,
                  double spatialResolution)
                           throws JPARSECException
        Resamples a given difraction pattern to a given resolution, using P. Thévenaz 2d interpolation. This method should only be used with patterns generated with this class.
        Parameters:
        pattern - The input difraction pattern.
        spatialResolution - The spatial resolution desired for the new pattern in arcseconds.
        Returns:
        The new pattern.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • convolve

        public static int[][][] convolve(double[][] pattern,
                 int difraction_pattern_field,
                 int[][] screen_in,
                 double field,
                 int background)
        Convolves a given sky image with a given telescope pattern. This method can be extremely slow.
        Parameters:
        pattern - The telescope difraction pattern.
        difraction_pattern_field - Field of the pattern in arcseconds.
        screen_in - The set of RGB colors for the sky image as a [x][y] matrix.
        field - The field of view of the sky image in radians.
        background - The background color. Should be close to black.
        Returns:
        The convolved sky image as a set of colors. The matrix is [RGB][x][y], where the first dimension identifies the R, G, and B colors of the image planes separately.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        For unit testing only.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
